content.raw:
Oh I see, so I didn't add a `File` API for the `stl` loader when we merged in the `sdfviewer` API, thats why I'm not testing the loading of the meshes.

I'll update the `stl`loader part to be like the other loaders and support loading `files`.

Thanks for reminding me!.
content.html:
Oh I see, so I didn't add a File API for the stl loader when we merged in the sdfviewer API, thats why I'm not testing the loading of the meshes.

I'll update the stlloader part to be like the other loaders and support loading files.

Thanks for reminding me!.

content.raw:
which we can do, according to the `STLLoader` docs, to use the parse function we need to have the `stl` mesh as a json.
So I guess we will leave the `loadStl` as it is for now.

https://threejs.org/docs/#api/loaders/ObjectLoader

content.raw:
Now I'm the one getting confused  :sweat_smile:

Are we supposed to have meshes that shouldn't have materials?

this is what happened when I replaced all null materials by gazebo's white material. 

It is almost all white -tried different colors same problem-.

![pr2allwhite.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/r77Gja/images/2718122278-pr2allwhite.png)
content.html:
Now I'm the one getting confused

Are we supposed to have meshes that shouldn't have materials?

this is what happened when I replaced all null materials by gazebo's white material.

It is almost all white -tried different colors same problem-.

content.raw: The thing is that the collada meshes can have their materials described within the collada file itself, but STL meshes will never have their own materials.
content.html: The thing is that the collada meshes can have their materials described within the collada file itself, but STL meshes will never have their own materials.

content.raw: That explains it, okay gonna apply this condition only if it is an `stl` mesh :thumbsup:
content.html: That explains it, okay gonna apply this condition only if it is an stl mesh
